name: df-rgr
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(crgr, copab(s0, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cxnn0), wral(s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ RegGraph = { < s0, s1 > |(s1 ∈ ℕ0* ∧ ∀(s2 ∈(Vtx ` s0),((VtxDeg ` s0)` s2)= s1))}
comment: Define the "k-regular" predicate, which is true for a "graph" being k-regular: read ` G RegGraph K ` as " ` G ` is ` K `-regular" or " ` G ` is a ` K `-regular graph". Note that ` K ` is allowed to be positive infinity ( ` K e. NN0* ` ), as proposed by GL. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 26-Dec-2020.)
